creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text:
The file tomcat.sh asumes that `which java` finds the real
java program.
But if java is a sumbolic link, 
e.g. /usr/bin/java -> /usr/java/bin/java, 
it will set java_home to /usr, and
try to find /usr/lib/tools.jar instead of /usr/java/lib/tools.jar.
This will make tomcat.sh fail to detect a java 1.2.x environment and will ultimatly fail to use jsp pages.
The workaround is to set JAVA_HOME before running tomcat.sh
creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com

text:
This should be resolved in 3.3 - tools.jar are added to the classpath in
Main.java, using System.getProperty(). The shell script needs cleanup, but it's
better to not mess with it - using java -jar and no shell is far better.
